metadata.title: CVE-2024-39498 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/mst: Fix NULL pointer dereference at drm_dp_add_payload_part2[Why]Commit:- commit 5aa1dfcdf0a4 ("drm/mst: Refactor the flow for payloadallocation/removement")accidently overwrite the commit- commit 54d217406afe ("drm: use mgr->dev in drm_dbg_kms indrm_dp_add_payload_part2")which cause regression.[How]Recover the original NULL fix and remove the unnecessary input parameter'state' fordrm_dp_add_payload_part2().(cherry picked from commit 4545614c1d8da603e57b60dd66224d81b6ffc305)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-39498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
